meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of earth in color, taste, or smell.
meanings.sent1: The earthier tones of the painting gave it a natural and rustic feel.
meanings.sent2: Her earthier cooking style focused on using fresh herbs and simple ingredients.
meanings.sent3: He joked that his earthier socks were so dirty, they could plant a garden.
meanings.sent4: The earthier scent of the forest enveloped her like a cozy blanket.
meanings.sent5: The earthier hues of the landscape painting made it feel like stepping into nature.

meanings.definition: Having a close connection to nature or the earth.
meanings.sent1: The earthier lifestyle of the villagers involved farming and living off the land.
meanings.sent2: She felt earthier when walking barefoot on the grass, connecting with the earth.
meanings.sent3: The earthier bond between the siblings was evident in their shared love for hiking.
meanings.sent4: Her earthier spirit was reflected in her passion for gardening and outdoor activities.
meanings.sent5: The earthier traditions of the tribe emphasized harmony with the natural world.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of refinement or sophistication.
meanings.sent1: His earthier manners sometimes surprised the elegant guests at the party.
meanings.sent2: The earthier decor of the cabin contrasted with the modern design of the city apartment.
meanings.sent3: She found his earthier jokes amusing, even if they were a bit crude.
meanings.sent4: The earthier language used by the comedian resonated with the down-to-earth audience.
meanings.sent5: The earthier style of the pottery workshop embraced imperfections and natural textures.
